2019/KER/305
Crl.MC.No. 6698 of 2018 2
ORDER

The petitioner herein is the respondent in M.C. No.19 of 2016
on the file of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court No.1, Chitoor.
The said case has been initiated by the respondent herein before
under the provisions of the Protection of Women from the
Domestic Violence Act, 2005.

2. The petitioner filed an application to summon a witness
and by order dated 15.9.2018, the said application was allowed by
the learned Magistrate. It is evident from Annexure-A6 that the
case was posted to 16.10.2018 and the petitioner was ordered to
take steps. On 6.10.2018, as the witness summoned did not
appear, the learned Magistrate proceeded to close the evidence
and posted the matter for hearing.

3. Heard the learned counsel appearing for the petitioner
and the learned Public Prosecutor.

4. Essentially, the contention advanced by the learned
counsel appearing for the petitioner is that the learned Magistrate

2019/KER/305
Crl.MC.No. 6698 of 2018 3
was not justified in not granting the petitioner an opportunity to
let in evidence.

5. As to what prompted the learned Magistrate to abruptly
post the matter for hearing is not discernible from the order.
Where a person fails to appear before the Court in spite of the
service of summons on him, the Magistrate has to take steps for
securing the presence of the witness under Section 87 of the
Code.

6. For the aforementioned reason, the order dated
6.10.2018 closing the evidence is set aside. The learned
Magistrate is directed to secure the presence of the witness
summoned by the petitioner as per law and afford an opportunity
to the petitioner to let in evidence.

With the above said direction, this petition is disposed of.

SD/-
RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN V.,
JUDGE
